fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35511].
  {panel}

I am creating a two dimensional filter on a dashboard, but the "status" field is not showing up as a link. The linking is something that we've come to rely on (since it allows all issues in a row/column to be summarized rather than clicking on every column).
The existing two dimensional filters are also broken, but only for the "status" field. The other field values that we use as X and Y axes continue to link to a summary of the row/column.

I am using JIRA/Atlassian OnDemand.

To reproduce:
# I created a new Two Dimensional Filter and selected an existing filter. The filter I chose contains all issues assigned to me from a single project.
# I selected "Issue Type" for my X axis value, and "Status" for YAxis.
# I clicked the Save button and observed that the status column headers did not appear as links nor could I click on them. I can, however, click on the Issue type column as a link.

I attached a screenshot of the table I see created.
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter does not create a link to "status" field

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35509].
  {panel}

Apologies if this is a dupe, I had a look and couldn't find a similar request.

It would be great to add a new feature to "Edit and Share Dashboard", where you could select users or groups of users who can then edit the same dashboard.

We share dashboards across teams in our company. Most of our dashboards are public for anyone in the company to add.
Development Managers add dashboards that PMs create, and would often like to add gadgets, but cannot due to the current limitations.

Let me know if anything isn't clear.

Thanks

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35502].
  {panel}

When first searching with a query such as the following:
status changed to "To Do" during (startofweek("+1d"), endofweek("+1d"))
you will receive correct results. Saving this filter, and recalling it again from the Issue Navigator (ie, via the Favorite Filters tab) will strip the double quotes, JIRA will load the following JQL and fail as the + is a protected character:
status changed to "To Do" during (startofweek(+1d), endofweek(+1d))
This means the saved filter cannot be used in Gadgets or be recalled again.
fields.summary: JQL removes double quotes (") from startOfTheWeek("+xd") and other functions

fields.description:
After performing a JIRA upgrade from 5.2 to 6.1, many users data got modified:
* *Username* is kept the same
* *Full Name* was cleared and replaced by the *UserName* value
* *Email* was cleared

We performed the upgrade on +three different+ test instances, and we had the problem randomly on the three instances.

For example, user1 & user2 both exist on two different instances running on v5.2 - the users were created manually and inhertited from LDAP. These two instances were copied to two TEST environments on v5.2. These TEST instances were upgraded to v6.1.
user1 is OK on one TEST instance but is messed up on the second.
user2 is messed up on both TEST instances.

We can have a user3 who is OK on both TEST instances

+*Screenshots on the messed up user (_me_):*+

* On JIRA 5.2:
!JIRA_5.2_User.png!

* On JIRA 6.1:
!JIRA_6.1_User.png!
fields.summary: [User Management] Upgrading to 6.1 clears user Emails and replaces Full Name with UserName

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35476].
  {panel}

When running JIRA Attach Screenshot with latest JAVA 7 update 45, user will see a section of security message in the dialog: _This application will be blocked in a future Java security update because the JAR file manifest does not contain the Permissions attribute. Please contact the Publisher for more information._

Additionally, it may display a SecurityException, causing the screenshot functionality to fail.

h5. Steps to Reproduce:
# Update a client machine JAVA to JAVA 7 update 45
# Access JIRA and perform the "Attach Screenshot" operation
# The security message will shown in the dialog:
!JAVA+warning.png|thumbnail!

Note: Only reproduce in JAVA 7 update 45 which related to the [Permission Attribute added|https://blogs.oracle.com/java/entry/java_se_7_update_45] in latest update.

h5. Resolution

This has been fixed in JIRA 6.1.7, and will also be included in JIRA 6.2.

h5. Workaround

The following workaround is available for customers on older versions of JIRA as an interim measure until an upgrade is performed:

# Download the attached screenshot.jar file.
# Replace the existing file in {{<jira-install>/atlassian-jira/secure/applet}}.
# Restart JIRA.

*Important*: Please make sure to test these changes in a staging/test environment before doing it in the production system. 

We have internally tested the workaround against JIRA 4.4.5, 5.0.7,5.1.8,5.2.11,6.0.8, 6.1.6 and no problems observed.
_Please note that under jira 4.x The screenshot applet window will not close upon attaching the issue due to a javascript error. You can close the window manually once you have checked that the screenshot has been attached successfully._
fields.summary: Security Dialog in Screenshot Applet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35469].
  {panel}

Edit: Sorry, the previous description was technically incorrect. I have updated this with a better one.
---------------------------------

Currently the user name picker only matches the beginning letters of a whole word. For example, you can find "John Smith" by typing "Jo" or "Sm", but not "th" even though "th" is a part of "Smith". This is not a problem with Western names.

This, however, doesn't work well with East Asian names (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) in which the family name and given name are not separated by spaces. For example, if there's a person with family name "张" and given name "无忌", the full name appears as "张无忌". Now you can't find this person in the user name picker by just typing his given name "无忌". You must type "张" to find him.

As a workaround, we have to add a white space into the user name and make it look like "张 无忌". This makes it searchable, but is against the language. The extra white space also looks really weird when appearing in sentences which doesn't have word separators at all.
fields.summary: User picker not friendly with East Asian names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35449].
  {panel}

When I try to translate the descriptions of my custom fields I'm getting into a conflict with the description in the field configurations for those custom fields.

If I clear the description in the field configuration it refills automatically with the translation of the custom field (in the language of the the current admin user profile).

If I now change my profile language the translation of the Custom Field itself works fine. But the translation of the custom field description does not work. It is overwritten by the description of the field configuration (which before had been automatically refilled with the translation of the other language).

{panel}
h4. Findings
The description for custom field does not translate if you are upgrading from previous version of JIRA. Any newly created custom field will have the description translated properly. 

h5. Test case:
# Create a custom field on JIRA 4.2.1 and add description.
# Upgrade to JIRA 6.1.4 (note that translation of custom field was introduced in JIRA 6. See [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TRANS-69?focusedCommentId=473485&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-473485]
# Translate the custom field prior to the upgrade, assume it's Japanese
# Change Default Language to Japanese. (result: description of the custom field will not be translated)
# As a comparison, create a new custom field after the upgrade and perform step 3 & 4. You will now see that the description is translated as well
{panel}
fields.summary: Translation of Custom Field Description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35447].
  {panel}

If you move issues from one project to another by using bulk change, jira will drop all custom field values that are not enabled for the target project and issue type without warning the user about it.

The best it would be if the custom field values would be kept, even if they are not enabled for the target issue type, so when the jira admin will re-enable them the data will still be there.

Another alternative, which could be harder to implement, is to warn about this before doing this, so the admin has the opportunity to enable these fields before loosing the data.

I am marking this as Critical because data is lost without any warnings.
fields.summary: Bulk Moving Issues could drop custom field data without warning

#2 webhooks-http-retriever:thread-3 WARN      [webhooks.util.http.Cac
hingHttpContentRetriever] Unable to post information to 'http://christophe:6990/bamboo/rest/api/latest/queue/TST-OCBP' a
s user 'null' due to: Input length = 1

If I test the url in a REST client, it will not pass until I specify at least  Content-Type and sometimes a payload, be it empty (for example content-type/xml does not need a payload, content-type/json needs one)

To replicate the problem :
#1 Create a webhook with url : http://bamboo.server/rest/api/latest/queue/PLAN-KEY, deactivate all events
#2 Add web hook as a post function of a transition
#3 update issue so as to pass the transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35436].
  {panel}

If a catch email is specified as part of a group address (http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt section A.1.3) JIRA does not parse it.

Three scenarios exist here:

# Catch email exists before the group:
{code}To: "John Smith" <catchemail@example.com>,
        Web Support: "Web Support minor" <minorsupport@example.com>,
        "WebSupport Major" <majorsupport@example.com>;{code} 
# Catch email exists after the group: 
{code}To: Web Support: "Web Support minor" <minorsupport@example.com>,
        "WebSupport Major" <majorsupport@example.com>;,
        "John Smith" <catchemail@example.com>{code}
# Catch email exists within the group: 
{code}To: Web Support: "Web Support minor" <minorsupport@example.com>,
        "WebSupport Major" <majorsupport@example.com>,
        "John Smith" <catchemail@example.com>;{code}

Scenarios 1 and 2 result in a properly parsed email.
Scenario 3 results in a "do not match the catch email" error.

Expected: Scenario 3 should be parsed without issue.

Steps to repro:

# Download the ingroup.eml file and place it within the <JIRA HOME>/import/mail folder
# Add a new mail handler, and specify the local directory instead of a POP/IMAP server
# Specify the catch email to be: {code}catchemail@example.com{code}
# Set a default assignee, and test the connection, click on More Details
# Error is: {code}Found 1 message(s) in the <JIRA HOME>/import/mail folder.
Cannot handle message as the recipient(s) (Web Support: "Web Support minor" <minorsupport@example.com>, "WebSupport Major" <majorsupport@example.com>, "John Smith" <catchemail@example.com>;) do not match the catch email catchemail@example.com{code}
fields.summary: JIRA's mail handler does not properly parse group email addresses
Allow editing of a workflow via "Import XML"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35434].
  {panel}

I added a post function for hipchat notification, then got this message:

Error in Notify Hipchat configuration for project XXXX (SK). Please contact your administrator to make sure that Notify Hipchat post-function is the last in the list.

I had to click on the down arrow 7 times to get it to the bottom of the list, and didn't see an easier way to move it around.  Would be nice if they could be reordered more simply or allow the user to enter the position in the list.

Best case would be to automatically optimize the order.  In this case, the error indicates that you know what the problem is, so might be possible to just correct it.
fields.summary: Would like ability to quickly or automatically reorder post-functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35428].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,
Let me describe my Atlassian stack administrator story:
Our project has own Atlassian stack (Jira/Confluence/Bamboo/Stash/Fisheye&Cru/Agile/Structure) for almost a year. We had to move from our company's Atlassian infrastructure because it's wasn't so flexible as we wanted and this infra didnt had as much features we have wanted. So we decided to move to our own Atlassian stack and we did a realy great job - we've created fully cross-integrated  stack with a lots of custom features including own macroses and plugins. 
I was the one who has designed and implemented almost all the features we have at the moment. I'm very happy to use such thoughtful&flexible tool  as Jira, Confluence, Bamboo, Stash and I'm excited every time I'm updating our Atlassian stack to a new major version with a lots of cool features.
Starting from Jira 4 and Confluence 4 i'm using installers for Windows  because I found them very useful for many reasons. But.
But there is a thing that causing me a discomfort and sometimes a headache...
As it was told we have a lots of custom modifications that needs to be moved manualy(Proxy ops for tomcat, config modifications, custom plugins, libs and etc) and every time I start the update process using installer I'd like to have a checkbox that will say "Start Jira|Confluence after the update is finished" or "Don't start Jira|Confluence after the update is finished" and Jira or Confluence will not start before I will want it to start. Otherwise Jira(Confluence) usualy starts to do crazy things because of missing fields, spam Exceptions in logs,two times even database was corrupted and we had to rollback. Of Course I have the workaround but it's looks like a dirty-hack. I think my life (and not only mine;) ) will be much happier if your will add the mentioned checkbox to your installer.

Hope for your understanding!

P.S. Many thanks to Atlassian team! You do outstanding things!
fields.summary: Add "Don't start Jira after the update" checkbox to Jira/Confluence installer for Windows

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35422].
  {panel}

Currently there is no option to make the Work Description field in {{View Issue Screen >> More >> Log Work}} a required field. Having one would be nice.

h3. Workaround
The best options seem to be the following plugins:
* [JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions].
* [Tempo Timesheets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/is.origo.jira.tempo-plugin].

Please note they both are third party plugins and they are not supported by Atlassian. Please contact the plugin vendors if you need more information on them.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35376].
  {panel}

I just spent 2 days changing descriptions on a bunch of fields in our JIRA environment which would have only taken about an hour if the Descriptions in the Field Configurations had the ability to inherit the descriptions from the parent field.  This is currently very misleading when it allows you to create a description on the field itself, but once the field is created, any changes to the description need to be done in each Field Configuration.

I would suggest supplying a checkbox in the Edit view for the field in the Field Configuration which will allow you to inherit the description from the parent field.  Then, when viewing the field information on the global level, have a little dropdown of sorts, like you do for Field Configurations Shared by projects, but have it list all the Field Configurations which do NOT inherit the description from the parent field.

This will make it extremely easy to manage these descriptions in the future for massive changes.

Example of the massive change that we had to do:  We have a Engineering specific Help document on our SharePoint environment, and the location of the document changed.  So i had to go through and change every single instance that used that link to the new URL.  It took an extremely long time to do.
fields.summary: Provide a method to inherit description in Field Configuration from parent field
Update OnDemand Balsamiq Mockup Plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35374].
  {panel}

I've created a custom field Severity, with two contexts. Project FOO has options as below:
||Option||Sequence||
|Critical|0|
|Major|1|
|Minor|2|
Project BAR has options as below:
||Option||Sequence||
|None|0|
|Critical|1|
|Major|2|
|Minor|3|
|N/A|4|

When sorting these in the Issue Navigator, Major in project FOO is considered to be equivalent to Critical in BAR, which looks like an inconsistent result to our users. While this behaviour makes sense from a technical standpoint, it would be a great improvement to check for matching names and merge them for sorting.
fields.summary: When using identical Select List option names in two contexts for the same field, sorting is not intuitive in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35371].
  {panel}

It would be very useful to have a JIRA notification count marker overlayed on the JIRA browser tab favicon. 

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6296574/dynamic-favicon-with-count-like-gmail

Many modern websites do this with a small red circle with a white notification count overlayed on the favicon.

It lets me instantly know when I need to give attention to a web app in my browser. I would rather see a notification in my browser than having to enter my email.
fields.summary: Add a dynamic favicon with a JIRA notification count for the logged in user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35370].
  {panel}

Modern browsers have added a very useful pinned tab functionality:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/pinned-tabs-keep-favorite-websites-open#w_how-are-pinned-tabs-different-than-normal-tabs

One feature of pinned tabs is tab highlighting. When the title of the pinned tab changes, the tab is highlighted with a glow effect.

This is very useful for quickly viewing notifications from many different websites.

If this feature were implemented I could completely disable my JIRA email notifications. This is a big win for cutting down on the users everyday email deluge.
fields.summary: Highlight pinned browser tabs when a JIRA notification is sent to the logged in user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35369].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When exporting JIRA issues to Excel, it exports files in XLS files. The same occurs for exports to Word, which generates files in DOC format. These files have multiple disadvantages when compared to the new file types introduced by Microsoft in 2007 (DOCX, XLSX and PPTX). That's because those new file formats are XML-based, which allows for much better compression, resulting in considerably smaller files.

Also, Excel's new file format (XLSX) adds an extra layer of security by blocking the usage of Macros, which requires the file to be saved as XLSM. XLS files allows for any Macro to be included and is being blocked by multiple System Administrators, especially in companies with higher standards for security.

h3. Example
Exporting around 4900 issues to Excel from JIRA currently generates a file with an approximate size of 7.5 MB. If we convert that file to XLSX once it has been opened in Excel 2007 or later, the file size drops to less than 10% of the original file's size.

h3. Workaround
The [Better Excel Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.midori.jira.plugin.betterexcel], developed by Midori, adds additional features for exporting issues to Excel in JIRA, including the ability to export directly to XLSX.

(i) _Please note third-party add-ons, such as "Better Excel Plugin", *are not* supported by Atlassian. Therefore, support and maintenance is purely responsibility of the add-on's vendor._
fields.summary: JIRA Exports files in old format / standards resulting in large file sizes

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

Customers need the following plugin install to make their tasks easier:

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.wittified.jira.project-creator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35366].
  {panel}

In our [Connecting JIRA to Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+Oracle] documentation, the following is stated:
bq. Note, the {{<database-type/>}} element must specify your type of database, e.g. {{oracle11g}}. If you forget to do this and you start JIRA, your database tables may be created incorrectly.
{quote}
h4. Sample dbconfig.xml file

For more information about the child elements of <jdbc-datasource/> beginning with pool in the dbconfig.xml file above, see [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Tuning+Database+Connections].
{code:XML| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
 
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>oracle11g</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@dbserver:1521:ORCL</url>
    <driver-class>oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver</driver-class>
    <username>jiradbuser</username>
    <password>password</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
    <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
    <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
 
    <validation-query>select 1 from dual</validation-query>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>
   
    <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>
  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{code}
{quote}

However, JIRA does not have a oracle11g definition, and configuring JIRA to use that cause JIRA to fail to start correctly. Therefore, we need to fix this information in our documentation to avoid further problems for our customers.
fields.summary: Update our Connecting JIRA to Oracle documentation to use 'oracle10g' instead of 'oracle11g'
